contentrichtext.text: {{nihongo|'''Kaminaka'''|上那賀町|Kaminaka-chō}} was a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in [[Naka District, Tokushima|Naka District]], [[Tokushima Prefecture|Tokushima]], [[Japan]]. On March 1, 2005 Kaminaka was merged with the towns of [[Aioi, Tokushima|Aioi]] and [[Wajiki, Tokushima|Wajiki]], and the villages of [[Kisawa, Tokushima|Kisawa]] and [[Kito, Tokushima|Kito]], all from [[Naka District, Tokushima|Naka District]], to form the new city of [[Naka, Tokushima|Naka]]. As of 2003, the town had an estimated [[population]] of 2,242 and a [[population density|density]] of 12.79 persons per km². The total area was 175.27 km². == External links == *[http://www.town.tokushima-naka.lg.jp/ Naka official website] {{ja icon}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Tokushima Prefecture]] {{Tokushima-geo-stub}}
